definition: Financial activities and transactions involving corporate stock ownership, trading, or portfolio management.

positive_examples: Apple's stock split gave shareholders twice as many shares at half the price.
The investment advisor recommended allocating 60% of the portfolio to stocks and 40% to bonds.
Tesla's stock price surged after the quarterly earnings report exceeded expectations.
She decided to diversify her investments by buying stocks in different sectors.
The company announced a 2-for-1 stock split to make shares more accessible to retail investors.
His asset allocation strategy focuses heavily on growth stocks and emerging markets.
negative_examples: The bank approved her mortgage application for the new house purchase.
He paid for groceries using his credit card at the checkout.
The company issued bonds to raise capital for expansion.
She withdrew cash from the ATM to pay for parking.
The insurance claim was processed within two business days.
He transferred money from checking to savings to earn higher interest.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BondTransactions, CurrencyExchange, BankingServices, InsuranceTransactions
